newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Voting starts in Bulgarian parliamentary elections.
newsitem.headline: Voting starts in Bulgarian parliamentary elections.

text.p: Voting got under way in Bulgaria on Saturday in parliamentary elections forced by demonstrators who took to the streets for month-long protests that toppled the former Socialist government in February.
Early turnout was low but was expected to pick up during the day. Polling stations close at 7 p.m. (1600 GMT) and first indications from exit polls are expected early in the night.
The reformist Union of Democratic Forces (UDF), which led the street protests, is seeking a mandate to carry out economic measures agreed with the International Monetary Fund and other lenders.
Final opinion polls published on Friday showed the UDF winning a majority in the 240-seat parliament with the Socialists as the biggest opposition party.
